content: When performing a match inside a do block, sometimes I just want the match to do nothing. Currently I am using pure (), but is their a better idiomatic solution? For example of when this is necessary: The fall through case (i.e., _), throws an error, other cases perform a action, but the do nothing case exists because I neither want it to perform an action or error.
you might be able to use just ()
lean does auto lifting into the monad in some cases, I'm not sure about what the extent is
